title: Data100: Supplementary Materials
text:
Welcome!
This book is intended as a supplement to R4DS and TMWR. It includes runnable code chunks that let you work through the chapters in a browser (without needing RStudio open).
I will also use this in class to set up some active learning assignmnets and participation quizzes. This way you can still particpate in coding exercises even if you only have a phone or tablet.

title: 01 Data Visualization
text:
Chapter Follow-Along
Use the following code cell to follow along while reading the chapter. (You are encouraged to do this in RStudio instead!)
These supplementary notes use something called webr, which allows R to run in your browser (no installation needed)!

title: 01 Data Visualization
text: Please enable JavaScript to experience the dynamic code cell content on this page.

title: 01 Data Visualization
text:
Exercises

1.2 First Steps

How many rows are in penguins? How many columns?


Please enable JavaScript to experience the dynamic code cell content on this page.

What does the bill_depth_mm variable in the penguins data frame describe? Read the help for ?penguins to find out.


Please enable JavaScript to experience the dynamic code cell content on this page.

Make a scatterplot of bill_depth_mm vs. bill_length_mm. That is, make a scatterplot with bill_depth_mm on the y-axis and bill_length_mm on the x-axis. Describe the relationship between these two variables.


Please enable JavaScript to experience the dynamic code cell content on this page.

What happens if you make a scatterplot of species vs. bill_depth_mm? What might be a better choice of geom?


Please enable JavaScript to experience the dynamic code cell content on this page.

Why does the following give an error and how would you fix it?


Please enable JavaScript to experience the dynamic code cell content on this page.

What does the na.rm argument do in geom_point()? What is the default value of the argument? Create a scatterplot where you successfully use this argument set to TRUE.


Please enable JavaScript to experience the dynamic code cell content on this page.

Add the following caption to the plot you made in the previous exercise: “Data come from the palmerpenguins package.” Hint: Take a look at the documentation for labs().


Please enable JavaScript to experience the dynamic code cell content on this page.

Recreate the following visualization. What aesthetic should bill_depth_mm be mapped to? And should it be mapped at the global level or at the geom level?


Please enable JavaScript to experience the dynamic code cell content on this page.

Run this code in your head and predict what the output will look like. Then, run the code in R and check your predictions. (Note: ggplot2 accepts either “color” or “colour” as an argument. I am changing all instances to the Canadian spelling.)


Please enable JavaScript to experience the dynamic code cell content on this page.

Will these two graphs look different? Why/why not?


Please enable JavaScript to experience the dynamic code cell content on this page.


1.4 Visualizing distributions

Make a bar plot of species of penguins, where you instead assign species to the y aesthetic. How is this plot different?


Please enable JavaScript to experience the dynamic code cell content on this page.

How are the following two plots different? Which aesthetic, colour or fill, is more useful for changing the colour of bars?


Please enable JavaScript to experience the dynamic code cell content on this page.

Make a histogram of the carat variable in the diamonds dataset that is available when you load the ggplot2 package. Experiment with different binwidths. What binwidth reveals the most interesting patterns?


Please enable JavaScript to experience the dynamic code cell content on this page.


1.5.5 Visualizing Relationships

The mpg data frame that is bundled with the ggplot2 package contains 234 observations collected by the US Environmental Protection Agency on 38 car models. Which variables in mpg are categorical? Which variables are numerical? (Hint: Type ?mpg to read the documentation for the dataset.) How can you see this information when you run mpg?


Please enable JavaScript to experience the dynamic code cell content on this page.

Make a scatterplot of hwy vs. displ using the mpg data frame. Next, map a third, numerical variable to colour, then size, then both colour and size, then shape. How do these aesthetics behave differently for categorical vs. numerical variables?
In the scatterplot of hwy vs. displ, what happens if you map a third variable to linewidth?
What happens if you map the same variable to multiple aesthetics?


Please enable JavaScript to experience the dynamic code cell content on this page.

Make a scatterplot of bill_depth_mm vs. bill_length_mm and colour the points by species. What does adding colouring by species reveal about the relationship between these two variables? What about faceting by species?


Please enable JavaScript to experience the dynamic code cell content on this page.

Why does the following yield two separate legends? How would you fix it to combine the two legends?


Please enable JavaScript to experience the dynamic code cell content on this page.

Create the two following stacked bar plots. Which question can you answer with the first one? Which question can you answer with the second one?


Please enable JavaScript to experience the dynamic code cell content on this page.

title: 01 Data Visualization - In-Class
text:
Adding to a ggplot object
Add points to the following plot. The q1_check() function will tell you if you’ve done it right.
Note that there are parentheses “()” around the creation of ggplot object. We’ll talk about why this is in class. In short, it’s a technical reason that’s outside of the scope of the course but helps with grading things.
